Listen to each question, use the pause to answer it, then compare your response with the model answer.
සෑම ප්‍රශ්නයකටම සවන් දෙන්න, පිළිතුරු දීමට විරාමය භාවිතා කරන්න, ඉන්පසු ඔබේ පිළිතුර ආදර්ශ පිළිතුර සමඟ සසඳන්න.
ஒவ்வொரு கேள்வியையும் கேட்டு, இடைவெளியைப் பயன்படுத்தி பதிலளியுங்கள். பின்னர் உங்கள் பதிலை மாதிரி பதிலுடன் ஒப்பிடுங்கள்.

example_dialogues.text_a: Do you ride a motorbike on Tuesday?
example_dialogues.text_c: When do you ride a motorbike?
example_dialogues.text_d: I ride a motorbike on Monday.

dialogues.text_c: When do you use social media?

dialogues.text_a: Do you buy groceries on Friday?
Do you spend time with friends on Saturday?
dialogues.text_c: When do you spend time with friends?
dialogues.text_d: I spend time with friends on Friday.

dialogues.text_a: Do you play cricket on Monday?
Do you and your friend play cricket on Friday?

dialogues.text_a: Do you and your friend spend time together on Thursday?
dialogues.text_c: When do you and your friend spend time together?
dialogues.text_d: We spend time together on Friday.

 சரியான பதிலைத் தேர்ந்தெடுக்கவும்.

content.sentence:
What does an automobile mechanic do?

An automobile mechanic inspects engines and detects mechanical faults.

What does an automobile mechanic do?

He drains old engine oil and refills it with new oil after every service.

What does an automobile mechanic do?

He replaces air filters and spark plugs when they are dirty or worn out.

What does an automobile mechanic do?

He doesn’t tighten the wheel nuts after changing the tyre.

What does an automobile mechanic do?

He uses diagnostic equipment to scan the vehicle’s electronic system.

What does an automobile mechanic do?

He does not ignore warning lights on the dashboard during inspection.

What does an automobile mechanic do?

He adjusts the brake system and checks the fluid level carefully.

What does an automobile mechanic do?

He cleans the fuel injectors to improve engine performance.

What does an automobile mechanic do?

He does not test-drive the vehicle after completing the repair.

What does an automobile mechanic do?

He records maintenance details and updates the service logbook.

activity_b.text: An automobile mechanic inspects engines and detects mechanical faults.
He drains old engine oil and refills it with new oil after every service.
He replaces air filters and spark plugs when they are dirty or worn out.
He doesn’t tighten the wheel nuts after changing the tyre.
He uses diagnostic equipment to scan the vehicle’s electronic system.
He does not ignore warning lights on the dashboard during inspection.
He adjusts the brake system and checks the fluid level carefully.
He cleans the fuel injectors to improve engine performance.
He does not test-drive the vehicle after completing the repair.
He records maintenance details and updates the service logbook.

context.text:
Read the passage below carefully before you attempt the activities.
පහත පරිච්ඡේදය සලකා බලන්න. ඔබ ක්‍රියාකාරකම් උත්සාහ කිරීමට පෙර.
கீழே உள்ள பகுதியை கவனமாகப் படியுங்கள்.

activity_a.text:
Match the words to their definitions.
පදයන් ඔවුන්ගේ අර්ථයන්ට ගැලපෙන්න.
சொற்களை அவற்றின் வரையறைகளுடன் பொருத்துங்கள்.

activity_b.text:
Read the questions and choose the correct answer.
ප්‍රශ්න කියවන්න සහ නිවැරදි පිළිතුර තෝරන්න.
கேள்விகளைப் படித்து சரியான பதிலைத் தேர்ந்தெடுக்கவும்.

activity_c.text:
Put these jumbled words in the correct order, to make a sentence.
මෙම අකුරු ගැටුම් නිවැරදි අනුපිළිවෙලට තබා වාක්‍යයක් සාදන්න.
இந்த குழப்பமான வார்த்தைகளை சரியான வரிசையில் வைத்து ஒரு வாக்கியமாக மாற்றுங்கள்.

content.intro: The AutoTune 500 Digital Engine Analyser is designed for diagnostic testing of petrol and diesel engines.

subsections.subtitle: Main Components
items: Control Panel – contains the digital display, mode selector, and test buttons.
Probe Leads – connect to spark-plug wires or sensors for measurement.
RPM Clamp – measures engine speed directly from the ignition coil.
Battery Leads (Red/Black) – provide power and detect battery voltage.
USB Port – for connecting to a computer or diagnostic tablet.
Data Port (OBD-II) – interfaces with modern vehicles for ECU readings.
Cooling Fan Vent – prevents overheating during extended use.
Carrying Handle – for easy transport between work bays.

steps: Unpack the analyser and check for all accessories.
Connect the battery leads: red to positive (+), black to negative (–).
Attach the RPM clamp around the ignition cable if required.
Plug the OBD-II connector into the vehicle diagnostic port (usually under the dashboard).
Press the Power button to start the unit.
Select the test mode (RPM, Voltage, Timing, Emission, or Sensor Check) on the control panel.
For data logging, connect the USB cable to your computer and open the AutoTune Utility Software.

subsections.subtitle: Engine Test
items: Choose “Engine Diagnostics”.
Start the vehicle engine.
The display will show RPM, voltage, and timing advance readings.

subsections.subtitle: Battery & Charging Test
items: Select “Battery Mode”.
Follow on-screen prompts to measure charge rate and alternator output.

subsections.subtitle: Sensor Test
items: Select the sensor type (e.g. oxygen sensor or throttle position sensor).
Observe live data on the screen or save results to the USB drive.

subsections.subtitle: Data Export
items: Connect to PC.
Open AutoTune Utility.
Click “Export Report” to generate a PDF summary.

subsections.subtitle: Common Issues and Solutions
items: No Power: Check clamps and vehicle battery connection.
No Reading: Ensure probes and OBD-II cable are firmly connected.
Inaccurate RPM Display: Adjust clamp position or recalibrate in settings.
Software Not Detecting Device: Reinstall the AutoTune driver or use another USB port.

subsections.subtitle: Maintenance Tips
items: Keep leads clean and store them in the provided case.
Wipe the screen and body with a dry, lint-free cloth.
Do not expose it to rain or high humidity.
Update firmware via the official AutoTune website every six months.
Always turn off the engine before connecting or disconnecting cables.
Keep cables away from hot engine parts.
Use only original accessories.
Do not attempt to open the unit; servicing must be done by authorised technicians.

content.item_b: the production and discharge of something, especially gas or radiation
a wire or connector used to detect electrical signals from engine parts
a tool that measures engine speed using ignition pulses
the process of identifying vehicle faults using electronic tools
to adjust a measuring instrument for accurate readings

Questions.question: What is the main purpose of the AutoTune 500 Digital Engine Analyser?
Questions.answer: To perform diagnostic testing of petrol and diesel engines
options: To perform diagnostic testing of petrol and diesel engines

Questions.question: Which component connects the analyser to the vehicle’s ECU for readings?
What should you do if the software does not detect the device?
Questions.answer: Reinstall the AutoTune driver or use another USB port
options: Reinstall the AutoTune driver or use another USB port

Questions.question: How often should the firmware be updated?
What safety precautions must be followed before connecting or disconnecting cables?

activity_c.sentence: Unpack the analyser and check for all accessories.
Keep leads clean and store them in the provided case.
Keep cables away from hot engine parts.
Wipe the screen and body with a dry cloth.
Do not expose yourself to rain or high humidity.
